channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: After 4 attempts, Abdi Nageeye wins the NYC marathon
item.description: Abdi Nageeye, 35, from the Netherlands, finished first in the men’s race with a time of 2:07:39. Meanwhile, Seila Chepkirui, 33, from Kenya, claimed victory in the women's race with 2:24.35.
item.content:encoded:
Abdi Nageeye, 35, from the Netherlands, finished first in the men’s race with a time of 2:07:39. Meanwhile, Seila Chepkirui, 33, from Kenya, claimed victory in the women's race with 2:24.35.

(Image credit: Timothy A. Clary)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump and Harris crisscross campaign trail days out from Election Day
item.description: President Trump held rallies in three states on Sunday, while Vice President Harris focused on Michigan.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump held rallies in three states on Sunday, while Vice President Harris focused on Michigan.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: A simple truth is at the root of many false election claims: Voter rolls are imperfect
item.description: At the heart of many election conspiracy theories is a simple truth: America’s voter rolls are imperfect. The U.S. doesn’t have a central voting list. It has a bunch of different lists.
item.content:encoded:
At the heart of many election conspiracy theories is a simple truth: America’s voter rolls are imperfect. The U.S. doesn’t have a central voting list. It has a bunch of different lists.

(Image credit: Bill Pugliano)
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: Meet the religious leaders shaping the next generation of social justice activism
item.description: The Yale Center for Public Theology and Public Policy is raising up the next generation of Christian leaders focused on social justice. It's led by Rev. William Barber, after retirement from his longtime congregation.
item.content:encoded:
The Yale Center for Public Theology and Public Policy is raising up the next generation of Christian leaders focused on social justice. It's led by Rev. William Barber, after retirement from his longtime congregation.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: Severe storms hit Oklahoma, injuring at least 11 and leaving thousands without power
item.description: Severe storms and tornadoes battered Oklahoma early Sunday, tossing cars and ripping roofs off buildings in the middle of the night.
item.content:encoded:
Severe storms and tornadoes battered Oklahoma early Sunday, tossing cars and ripping roofs off buildings in the middle of the night.

(Image credit: KOCO)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What a big Republican win Tuesday could mean for Obamacare
item.description: With the Affordable Care Act once again under fire from Republicans, a leading health care economist explains what a Republican sweep might mean for the health coverage of 45 million Americans.
item.content:encoded:
With the Affordable Care Act once again under fire from Republicans, a leading health care economist explains what a Republican sweep might mean for the health coverage of 45 million Americans.

(Image credit: Wilfredo Lee)
item.dc:creator: Dan Gorenstein

item.title: 'I have more say': Why Kathryn Hahn feels more powerful than ever
item.description: In this week's Wild Card, Kathryn Hahn says she has more control over her choices and is not as afraid to say what she wants.
item.content:encoded:
In this week's Wild Card, Kathryn Hahn says she has more control over her choices and is not as afraid to say what she wants.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Why more Native Americans are on U.S. ballots than ever before
item.description: At least 170 Native American, Native Hawaiians, and Native Alaskans are on ballots this fall, an all-time high. But a group tracking Indigenous candidates says more work needs to be done.
item.content:encoded:
At least 170 Native American, Native Hawaiians, and Native Alaskans are on ballots this fall, an all-time high. But a group tracking Indigenous candidates says more work needs to be done.

(Image credit: Chandan Khanna)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: U.S. says Iranian-American held in Iran as tensions high following Israeli attack
item.description: The imprisonment of Reza Valizadeh, acknowledged to the AP by the U.S. State Department, came as Iran marked the 45th anniversary of the American Embassy takeover and hostage crisis on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
The imprisonment of Reza Valizadeh, acknowledged to the AP by the U.S. State Department, came as Iran marked the 45th anniversary of the American Embassy takeover and hostage crisis on Sunday.

(Image credit: Vahid Salemi/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 10 key demographic groups that could decide the presidential election
item.description: From voters young and older to the potentially very wide gender gap, here's what to watch for as the election results come in.
item.content:encoded:
From voters young and older to the potentially very wide gender gap, here's what to watch for as the election results come in.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro
